com.myronmarston.music.scales
Class MajorScale

java.lang.Object
  com.myronmarston.music.scales.Scale
      com.myronmarston.music.scales.MajorScale

public class MajorScale
extends Scale

The most common scale used in western music. This scale uses the following whole step (W) / half step (H): WWHWWWH

isInvalidKeyName

protected boolean isInvalidKeyName(NoteName keyName)
Description copied from class: Scale
Gets whether or not the passed key name is valid. For example, G# major is invalid, because it requires 8 sharps (i.e. 6 sharps and 1 double sharp) and the midi specification does not allow that. However, G# minor is a valid key, so the scale must determine what is valid and invalid.

Specified by:
isInvalidKeyName in class Scale
Parameters:
keyName - the key name to test
Returns:
true if the key is not allowed by the midi specification

getScaleStepArray

protected int[] getScaleStepArray()
Description copied from class: Scale
Gets an array of integers representing the number of half steps above the tonic for each scale step.

Specified by:
getScaleStepArray in class Scale
Returns:
array of integers
